meanings.definition: A list of people who are waiting for something, such as a service or product.
meanings.sent1: The waitlist for the popular restaurant was so long that many customers decided to go elsewhere.
meanings.sent2: I put my name on the waitlist for the new video game release.
meanings.sent3: The waitlist for the ice cream truck was so long that some people started doing cartwheels to pass the time.
meanings.sent4: Being on the waitlist for the concert felt like being in a never-ending line that never moved.
meanings.sent5: The waitlist for the limited edition sneakers was like a race to the finish line, with only a few lucky winners.

meanings.definition: To place someone on a list to wait for something.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant had to waitlist many customers due to the high demand.
meanings.sent2: I had to waitlist my friend for the exclusive event because the tickets were sold out.
meanings.sent3: I had to waitlist my cat for the vet appointment, and she was not happy about it.
meanings.sent4: The teacher had to waitlist some students for the field trip because there were limited spots available.
meanings.sent5: The airline had to waitlist passengers for the overbooked flight, causing some delays and frustrations.
